results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part film using animation and the setting of a doctor’s surgery to discuss the skeletal, muscular, nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems of the human body. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: About Trevelyan
results.creator_credit: Peter Scroggs, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to History”.
A discussion between four academic historians about the ways in which the discipline of history, as they study and teach it, makes demands which sharply differentiates it from other kinds of history. They relate these points in the first place to the virtues and defects of some of the work of G. M. Trevelyan. Then B. Dodson of York University, discusses a newspaper series called “The Making of the British” and shows five points at which it departs from what he would consider professional standards of history.

results.title: About three hundred million years ago...
results.creator_credit: Jean Hunt, James Allen and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Shows geologists collecting data to make a geological map and the subsequent laboratory work required to identify the structure and composition of the samples collected. Once the information is compiled, the map can be drawn and ideas about the geological history of the area can be formed. Narrated by Sydney Conabere and photographed by Don Whitehurst. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: About The White bus
results.creator_credit: John Fletcher, Lindsay Anderson, Marlene Fletcher and Dateline Film Productions
results.brief_description: ‘The White bus’ was a dramatic film directed by Lindsay Anderson about a northern English town. John Fletcher, a friend and colleague of Anderson, has made a film about his friend at work, recording many private moments in the creation of the film; script, production, conferences, location work, editing, dubbing, music laying. An insight into the creative process of film production.

results.title: About sharks
results.brief_description: Notes the identifying characteristics and habits of a variety of sharks, such as the hammerhead and the carpet sharks; and shows their relationship with the smaller fish who clean them of parasites. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: About face
results.creator_credit: Chris James and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: This film gallops through over 60 facial transformations, including animated caricatures of Mick Jagger, Oscar Wilde, The Queen, The Duke of Edinburgh, Prince Charles, Pablo Picasso, Idi Amin, Salvador Dali, Adolf Hitler, The Marx Brothers, and David Bowie. Music by Claude Jouvin.

results.title: Abortion: stories from the north and south
results.brief_description: A documentary that looks at abortion and how it has affected many women from all cultures and social classes throughout the history of human beings. Women from all over the world are interviewed and they discuss the way in which their societies deal with abortion.
